name: nebula-oni-theme
description: Oni (鬼) is a type of ogre youkai and "Nebula Oni Theme" has colors from Outer Space! Nebula Oni has a Menu with a lot of different options, give it a try, customize it!
author: Renato Setoue

nebulaOni.color.backgroundColor.markdownDescription: Three different `background color` options for your theme! Each color has a *lighter* and a *darker* variant for different levels of contrast.

nebulaOni.color.mainColor.markdownDescription: Choose between six different colors for the headers, borders, icons and badges!

nebulaOni.editor.comments.markdownDescription: For `comments` you have 4 colors, the standard `Grey`, but also `Magenta`, `Forest` and `Violet`. Each with a *darker* and *lighter* option.

nebulaOni.editor.fontStyle.markdownDescription: `Italics` are used for very few parameters like `classes`, `namespace`, special keywords as well as `function parameters`.

nebulaOni.interface.focusBorder.markdownDescription: For accessibility reasons and for those that use keyboard to navigate through the interface, you have `focusBorder`, it's a border that appears when we use the mouse click or `tab`. If you don't use it, you can turn it off.

nebulaOni.interface.editorSelectionAndFi.markdownDescription: Options for `selection highlight` and `find match highlight`. Further configuration can be found on `Editor: Selection Highlight` in the Settings Menu
markdownEnumDescriptions: It makes it easy to identity same `parameters`

nebulaOni.applyChanges.markdownDescription: Select your options and use this `checkbox` to save your preferences. You will be prompted to `Reload Window` to apply the changes or you can do that later.

nebulaOni.update.restoreConfiguration.markdownDescription: Don't worry about this, this is just to save your settings so it can be restored automatically when Nebula Oni Theme is updated!

nebulaOni.add.favorite.markdownDescription: If you need a secondary option - maybe for different contrast settings -, save your `Favorite` so you can switch between them without having to `Reload Window`! Choose your **Syntax Color Scheme** and once you `Apply Changes`, the current settings of **Color**, **Editor** and **Interface** will be saved as *Nebula Oni (Favorite)* in the **WorkBench > Color Theme**.
